58 million people with disabilities in
58 million people with disabilities in

the United States
the United States

26+ million of these people have severe disabilities
26+ million of these people have
severe disabilities

4.6 million are under the age of 18

TAX INCENTIVES
TAX INCENTIVES

SMALL BUSINESS TAX CREDIT:
SMALL BUSINESS TAX CREDIT:

IRS CODE SECTION 44,
IRS CODE SECTION 44,

DISABLED ACCESS CREDIT
DISABLED ACCESS CREDIT

SMALL BUSINESSES MAY TAKE AN ANNUAL TAX CREDIT FOR MAKING THEIR BUSINESSES ACCESSIBLE TO PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES.
SMALL BUSINESSES MAY TAKE AN
ANNUAL TAX CREDIT FOR MAKING
THEIR BUSINESSES ACCESSIBLE
TO PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES.

TAX INCENTIVES
TAX INCENTIVES

WHO IS ELIGIBLE?
WHO IS ELIGIBLE?

SMALL BUSINESSES
SMALL BUSINESSES

THAT IN THE PREVIOUS YEAR EARNED A MAXIMUM OF $1 MILLION IN REVENUE OR HAD 30 OR FEWER FULL-TIME EMPLOYEES.
THAT IN THE PREVIOUS YEAR
EARNED A MAXIMUM OF $1
MILLION IN REVENUE OR HAD 30
OR FEWER FULL-TIME EMPLOYEES.

TAX INCENTIVE
TAX INCENTIVE

THE CREDIT IS 50 PERCENT OF EXPENDITURES OVER $250,
THE CREDIT IS 50 PERCENT OF
EXPENDITURES OVER $250,

NOT TO EXCEED $10,250, FOR A MAXIMUM BENEFIT OF $5,000.
NOT TO EXCEED $10,250, FOR A
MAXIMUM BENEFIT OF $5,000.

THE CREDIT AMOUNT IS SUBTRACTED FROM THE TOTAL TAX LIABILITY.
THE CREDIT AMOUNT IS
SUBTRACTED FROM THE TOTAL
TAX LIABILITY.

TAX INCENTIVE
TAX INCENTIVE

WHAT EXPENSES ARE COVERED?
WHAT EXPENSES ARE COVERED?

THE CREDIT IS AVAILABLE EVERY YEAR
THE CREDIT IS AVAILABLE EVERY
YEAR

ARCHITECTURAL/TRANSPORTATION
TAX DEDUCTION:

BUSINESSES MAY TAKE AN ANNUAL DEDUCTION FOR EXPENSES INCURRED TO REMOVE PHYSICAL, STRUCTURAL,

INCURRED TO REMOVE PHYSICAL,
STRUCTURAL,

TAX INCENTIVE

AND TRANSPORTATION BARRIERS FOR
AND TRANSPORTATION BARRIERS FOR

PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AT THE WORKPLACE.
PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AT
THE WORKPLACE.

WHO IS ELIGIBLE?
WHO IS ELIGIBLE?

ALL BUSINESSES ARE ELIGIBLE.
ALL BUSINESSES ARE ELIGIBLE.

TAX INCENTIVE
TAX INCENTIVE

BUSINESSES MAY TAKE A TAX DEDUCTION OF UP TO $15,000 A YEAR FOR EXPENSES INCURRED TO REMOVE BARRIERS FOR PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES.
BUSINESSES MAY TAKE A TAX
DEDUCTION OF UP TO $15,000 A
YEAR FOR EXPENSES INCURRED TO
REMOVE BARRIERS FOR PERSONS
WITH DISABILITIES.

TAX INCENTIVE
TAX INCENTIVE

WHAT EXPENSES ARE COVERED?
WHAT EXPENSES ARE COVERED?

THE DEDUCTION IS AVAILABLE EVERY YEAR. IT CAN BE USED FOR A VARIETY OF COSTS TO MAKE A FACILITY OR PUBLIC
THE DEDUCTION IS AVAILABLE
EVERY YEAR. IT CAN BE USED FOR A
VARIETY OF COSTS TO MAKE A
FACILITY OR PUBLIC

TAX INCENTIVE
TAX INCENTIVE

THE COST OF PROVIDING:
THE COST OF PROVIDING:

PROVIDING TELEPHONES, WATER FOUNTAINS, AND RESTROOMS
PROVIDING TELEPHONES, WATER
FOUNTAINS, AND RESTROOMS

WIDENING OF WALKWAYS
WIDENING OF WALKWAYS

TAX INCENTIVE
TAX INCENTIVE

WHAT EXPENSES ARE NOT COVERED? NEW CONSTRUCTION,
WHAT EXPENSES ARE NOT COVERED?
NEW CONSTRUCTION,

COMPLETE RENOVATION OF A FACILITY OR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION
COMPLETE RENOVATION OF A
FACILITY OR PUBLIC
TRANSPORTATION

NORMAL REPLACEMENT OF DEPRECIABLE PROPERTY.
NORMAL REPLACEMENT OF
DEPRECIABLE PROPERTY.

TAX INCENTIVE
TAX INCENTIVE

MAY I USE THE TAX CREDIT AND TAX DEDUCTION TOGETHER? SMALL BUSINESSES MAY USE THE CREDIT AND DEDUCTION TOGETHER,
MAY I USE THE TAX CREDIT AND
TAX DEDUCTION TOGETHER?
SMALL BUSINESSES MAY USE
THE CREDIT AND DEDUCTION
TOGETHER,

TAX INCENTIVE
TAX INCENTIVE

LIMITS ON ANNUAL USAGE?
LIMITS ON ANNUAL USAGE?

BOTH THE TAX CREDIT AND DEDUCTION MAY BE USED ANNUALLY, IF A BUSINESS SPENDS MORE THAN MAY BE CLAIMED IN ONE YEAR, IT CANNOT CARRY OVER THOSE EXPENSES AND CLAIM A TAX BENEFIT IN THE NEXT YEAR.
BOTH THE TAX CREDIT AND
DEDUCTION MAY BE USED
ANNUALLY, IF A BUSINESS SPENDS
MORE THAN MAY BE CLAIMED IN
ONE YEAR, IT CANNOT CARRY OVER
THOSE EXPENSES AND CLAIM A TAX
BENEFIT IN THE NEXT YEAR.

TAX INCENTIVE
TAX INCENTIVE

HOW CAN THIS CREDIT BE
HOW CAN THIS CREDIT BE

DEDUCTED? THE AMOUNT SPENT IS SUBTRACTED FROM THE TOTAL INCOME OF A BUSINESS TO ESTABLISH ITS TAXABLE INCOME.
DEDUCTED? THE AMOUNT SPENT IS
SUBTRACTED FROM THE TOTAL
INCOME OF A BUSINESS TO
ESTABLISH ITS TAXABLE INCOME.
